physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Burning sensation and edema of both palms after immersion in water, hyperlinearity of the palms, mild keratosis pilaris of the upper arms. Hands became edematous and painful with a thickened, translucent to whitish, pebbly appearance after immersion in water.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms worsened with warmer weather and more frequent swimming; initially normal findings on physical examination progressed to evident swelling after water exposure.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Painful whitish discoloration of palms, lateral fingers, and soles after immersion in water; lesions resolve spontaneously approximately 30 minutes after drying.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially limited to hands, but later involved the feet; improvement noted after treatment with aluminum chloride.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Painful, burning sensation affecting hands after immersion in water; hands become swollen within 10 minutes, resolution occurs within 60 minutes post drying.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial symptoms present for 2 months without significant changes; otherwise normal findings during examination.
